f3ed2168954e9d15552159db0fa704f9 (10:08): Anyone have a guide to .htaccess

b0a90be919a9f920bb8ad2caca4e91f0 (10:08): .htaccess is used for apache config directives - if it is not readable, apache can't use it - if you don't want to use htaccess at all, then set AllowOverride None in httpd.conf or http://httpd.apache.org/docs/configuring.html#htaccess or http://httpd.apache.org/docs/howto/htaccess.html or or see htaccess purpose

f3ed2168954e9d15552159db0fa704f9 (10:10): Ok. It states I shouldn't use it mainly if I have access to the main config files and I do.
f3ed2168954e9d15552159db0fa704f9 (10:10): I guess I won't be needing .htaccess - second question.. how can I make all files with extension ".xhtml" serve as mime type of xml?
226b9e1c7bbd2713c49719540bb89fdc (10:11): .htaccess is used for restricting your page to certain authenticated users
7be1696b6ec1c7927283f7648b2bd5a9 (10:15): n08l3J: Yes you use .htaccess for that.
7be1696b6ec1c7927283f7648b2bd5a9 (10:15): But also for changing mime types.

d3e055699cc9b893e60182d521012f56 (10:31): my working server was much too slow, so I slapped the hard drive into a faster machine...now all my server apps are listening on the correct ports except apache
d3e055699cc9b893e60182d521012f56 (10:32): that's the prob: listening on 0.0.0.0:<port>, while all other apps are listening on 192.168.x.x, the way they should be
b0a90be919a9f920bb8ad2caca4e91f0 (10:34): Listen tells apache what IP address and port to listen to. See http://httpd.apache.org/docs/2.2/mod/mpm_common.html#listen or see binding.
b0a90be919a9f920bb8ad2caca4e91f0 (10:34): Listen tells apache what IP address and port to listen to. See http://httpd.apache.org/docs/2.2/mod/mpm_common.html#listen or see binding.

b0a90be919a9f920bb8ad2caca4e91f0 (11:07): vhosts is see virtual hosts

b0a90be919a9f920bb8ad2caca4e91f0 (11:07): ip based vhosts is one way to host multiple domains and be able to use different certificates for each of those domains using ssl. see http://httpd.apache.org/docs/1.3/vhosts/ip-based.html or http://httpd.apache.org/docs/2.0/vhosts/ip-based.html or http://httpd.apache.org/docs/2.2/vhosts/ip-based.html

226b9e1c7bbd2713c49719540bb89fdc (11:08): hey megaspaz, a quick question for you
e4d7ac934a5608807fe9130e93a22a50 (11:08): hey n08l3J a drunken answer for you

226b9e1c7bbd2713c49719540bb89fdc (11:09): is it possible to run different websites on differnt ports, for eg site1 goes on port 80 and site2 for port 81 and site3 for port 82
e4d7ac934a5608807fe9130e93a22a50 (11:10): use listen and do your vhosts right
e4d7ac934a5608807fe9130e93a22a50 (11:11): with the servername/serveralias set in each vhost block
226b9e1c7bbd2713c49719540bb89fdc (11:12): mine works even without enabling the NameVirtualHost entry
e4d7ac934a5608807fe9130e93a22a50 (11:13): part of the mechanism used for name based virtualhosts
e4d7ac934a5608807fe9130e93a22a50 (11:13): if using name based virtualhosts
e4d7ac934a5608807fe9130e93a22a50 (11:14): fajita gave you links to 2 ways of doing vhosts. the differences are in the respective factoid links.

226b9e1c7bbd2713c49719540bb89fdc (11:15): megaspaz, is NameVirtualHost needed to be lying on the top of the vhosts file or is it needed to be individualy set in the virtual host directives of each site
e4d7ac934a5608807fe9130e93a22a50 (11:15): if you're using name based vhosts, yes.
e4d7ac934a5608807fe9130e93a22a50 (11:15): it needs to be defined before any virtualhost blocks are set...
226b9e1c7bbd2713c49719540bb89fdc (11:15): so i can declare all them at once at top right
e4d7ac934a5608807fe9130e93a22a50 (11:16): yeppirs. you only need 1 virtualhost per ip/port block though
e4d7ac934a5608807fe9130e93a22a50 (11:16): just keep that in mind...
